revised_title: On the Simplification of Perturbation Theory in Planetary Motion
tldr: The author presents a simplified method for determining the perturbations of a planet's orbit due to the influence of other celestial bodies. By reducing the problem to three differential equations, the author demonstrates a more efficient approach to understanding the effects of planetary perturbations on orbital elements. This method can be applied to any number of disturbing bodies and offers a valuable contribution to the study of celestial mechanics.
